hints_html: We want to find t subject to \(T(t) = 19\).
hints_latex: We want to find \emph{t} subject to $T(t) = 19$.
hints_raw: We want to find ''t'' subject to <math> T(t) = 19 </math>.
question: 2 (c)
sols_html:
From the previous question, we know that

\[\begin{aligned} T(t) - 19 = -16e^{kt}\end{aligned}\]

where

\(\displaystyle k = \frac{-\ln(2)}{30}\)

Searching for when \(T(t) = 16\) yields

\[\begin{aligned} 16-19 &= -16e^{kt} \\ -3 &= -16e^{kt} \\ \frac{3}{16} &= e^{kt} \\ \ln(3/16) &= kt\\ \ln(3/16) &= \frac{-\ln(2)t}{30} \\ t &= -30\frac{\ln(3/16)}{\ln(2)} \\ t &= 30\frac{\ln(16/3)}{\ln(2)} \end{aligned}\]

completing the question.
statement_html:
Full-Solution Problems. In questions 2-8, justify your answers and show all your work. If a box is provided, write your final answer there. Simplification of answers is not required unless explicitly requested.

When an apple is taken from a refrigerator, its temperature is \(3^{\circ}C\). After 30 minutes in a \(19^{\circ}C\) room, its temperature is \(11^{\circ}C\).

Determine when the temperature of the apple is \(16^{\circ}C\).

Simplification of answers is not required unless explicitly requested.
